verses.text: And, behold, there came a man of God out of Judah by the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* unto Beth-el : and Jeroboam stood by the altar to burn incense.\f + \fr 13.1 \ft burn: or, offer\f*

And he cried against the altar in the word of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and said , O altar , altar , thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; Behold, a child shall be born unto the house of David , Josiah by name ; and upon thee shall he offer the priests of the high places that burn incense upon thee, and men’s bones shall be burnt upon thee.

And he gave a sign the same day , saying , This \add is\add* the sign which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath spoken ; Behold, the altar shall be rent , and the ashes that \add are\add* upon it shall be poured out.

And it came to pass, when king Jeroboam heard the saying of the man of God , which had cried against the altar in Beth-el , that he put forth his hand from the altar , saying , Lay hold on him. And his hand , which he put forth against him, dried up , so that he could not pull it in again to him.
The altar also was rent , and the ashes poured out from the altar , according to the sign which the man of God had given by the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

And the king answered and said unto the man of God , Intreat now the face of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* thy God , and pray for me, that my hand may be restored me again. And the man of God besought the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and the king’s hand was restored him again , and became as \add it was\add* before.  +  r 13.6  t the \+nd LORD\+nd*, and: Heb. the face of the \+nd LORD\+nd*, etc *
And the king said unto the man of God , Come home with me, and refresh thyself, and I will give thee a reward.
And the man of God said unto the king , If thou wilt give me half thine house , I will not go in with thee, neither will I eat bread nor drink water in this place :
For so was it charged me by the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, saying , Eat no bread , nor drink water , nor turn again by the same way that thou camest.
So he went another way , and returned not by the way that he came to Beth-el. \p

¶ Now there dwelt an old prophet in Beth-el ; and his sons came and told him all the works that the man of God had done that day in Beth-el : the words which he had spoken unto the king , them they told also to their father.
And their father said unto them, What way went he? For his sons had seen what way the man of God went , which came from Judah.
And he said unto his sons , Saddle me the ass. So they saddled him the ass : and he rode thereon,
And went after the man of God , and found him sitting under an oak : and he said unto him, \add Art\add* thou the man of God that camest from Judah ? And he said , I \add am\add*.
Then he said unto him, Come home with me, and eat bread.
And he said , I may not return with thee, nor go in with thee: neither will I eat bread nor drink water with thee in this place :

For it was said to me by the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Thou shalt eat no bread nor drink water there, nor turn again to go by the way that thou camest.\f + \fr 13.17 \ft it…: Heb. a word was\f*

He said unto him, I \add am\add* a prophet also as thou \add art;\add* and an angel spake unto me by the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, saying , Bring him back with thee into thine house , that he may eat bread and drink water. \add But\add* he lied unto him.
So he went back with him, and did eat bread in his house , and drank water. \p
¶ And it came to pass, as they sat at the table , that the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came unto the prophet that brought him back :

And he cried unto the man of God that came from Judah , saying , Thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, Forasmuch as thou hast disobeyed the mouth of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and hast not kept the commandment which the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* thy God commanded thee,

But camest back , and hast eaten bread and drunk water in the place , of the which \add the \+nd Lord\+nd*\add* did say to thee, Eat no bread , and drink no water ; thy carcase shall not come unto the sepulchre of thy fathers. \p
¶ And it came to pass, after he had eaten bread , and after he had drunk , that he saddled for him the ass , \add to wit\add*, for the prophet whom he had brought back.
And when he was gone , a lion met him by the way , and slew him: and his carcase was cast in the way , and the ass stood by it, the lion also stood by the carcase.
And, behold, men passed by , and saw the carcase cast in the way , and the lion standing by the carcase : and they came and told \add it\add* in the city where the old prophet dwelt.

And when the prophet that brought him back from the way heard \add thereof\add*, he said , It \add is\add* the man of God , who was disobedient unto the word of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: therefore the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath delivered him unto the lion , which hath torn him, and slain him, according to the word of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, which he spake unto him.  +  r 13.26  t torn: Heb. broken *
And he spake to his sons , saying , Saddle me the ass. And they saddled \add him\add*.
And he went and found his carcase cast in the way , and the ass and the lion standing by the carcase : the lion had not eaten the carcase , nor torn the ass.\f + \fr 13.28 \ft torn: Heb. broken\f*
And the prophet took up the carcase of the man of God , and laid it upon the ass , and brought it back : and the old prophet came to the city , to mourn and to bury him.
And he laid his carcase in his own grave ; and they mourned over him, \add saying\add*, Alas , my brother !

And it came to pass, after he had buried him, that he spake to his sons , saying , When I am dead , then bury me in the sepulchre wherein the man of God \add is\add* buried ; lay my bones beside his bones :

For the saying which he cried by the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* against the altar in Beth-el , and against all the houses of the high places which \add are\add* in the cities of Samaria , shall surely come to pass. \p

¶ After this thing Jeroboam returned not from his evil way , but made again of the lowest of the people priests of the high places : whosoever would , he consecrated him, and he became \add one\add* of the priests of the high places.\f + \fr 13.33 \ft made…: Heb. returned and made\f*\f + \fr 13.33 \ft consecrated…: Heb. filled his hand\f*
And this thing became sin unto the house of Jeroboam , even to cut \add it\add* off , and to destroy \add it\add* from off the face of the earth.
